column1: #Text=[0134] In particular, the success of the fluid jet 9 removing completely all particles 30 is always achieved when the particles have been previously displaced from inner surface 5b, as shown in FIG. 8A.

#Text=[0135] According to a not shown exemplary structure, the means for adjusting the electrostatic force 40 and the means for removing 60 are arranged to act on a same container on the automatic production line.

#Text=In this case, the electrically conducting fluid 8 and the fluid jet 9 are mixed according to a determined ratio or the electrically conducting fluid 8 works at the same time as medium for adjusting the electric charge 40 and as medium 60 for removing fragments 30.
#Text=This configuration is structurally compact and can be optimized in order to maximize the fragment extraction efficiency 30.

#Text=[0136] In a further exemplary embodiment, shown in FIGS. 9 and 10, the means for adjusting the electric charge 40 and the means for removing 60 are introduced beyond the aperture of tubes 5', according to a determined depth.
#Text=This solution, as shown in FIGS. 9 and 10, is effective and adapted to tubes 5' having a closed end.
#Text=[0137] This way, the electrically conducting fluid 8 and the fluid jet 9 have a wider field of action and can lap the fragments 30 located on the bottom of the same.
#Text=[0138] In particular FIG. 9 shows a needle-like nozzle 1' of measured shape and size that is put in the container which has a closed end 5'.
#Text=This way, the ionized air flow 8 exiting from needle-like nozzle 1' has a speed and a movement suitable to feed ions 8a onto each surface and therefore each fragment 30 in container 5'.
